title: x-omitempty handling is incorrect with $ref

labels.name: model
labels.description: Related to swagger generate model command

body:
## Problem statement

The `x-omitempty` property is incorrectly processed in the presence of `$ref`.

When the referenced definition contains `x-omitempty`, it appears to be ignored.

When the reference has a sibling `x-omitempty` key, the `x-omitempty` is honoured but should not have been.

By comparison, `x-nullable` seems to work as expected in similar circumstances.

## Swagger specification
```yaml
swagger: "2.0"
info:
  title: ""
  version: ""
paths:
  /:
    get:
      description: ""
      responses:
        200:
          description: ""
definitions:

  Case-1--Fail--omitempty-false-not-hoisted-by-ref:
    type: object
    properties:
      Body:
        $ref: '#/definitions/Object-with-omitempty-false'

  Case-2--Fail--omitempty-false-not-overridden-by-ref-sibling:
    type: object
    properties:
      Body:
        $ref: '#/definitions/Object-with-omitempty-true'
        x-omitempty: false

  Case-3--Pass--object-nullable-false-hoisted-by-ref:
    type: object
    properties:
      Body:
        $ref: '#/definitions/Object-with-nullable-false'

  Case-4--Pass--object-nullable-false-overriden-by-ref-sibling:
    type: object
    properties:
      Body:
        $ref: '#/definitions/Object-with-nullable-true'
        x-nullable: false

  Object-with-omitempty-true:
    type: object
    properties:
      Data:
        type: object

  Object-with-omitempty-false:
    type: object
    properties:
      Data:
        type: object
    x-omitempty: false

  Object-with-nullable-true:
    type: object
    properties:
      Data:
        type: object
    x-nullable: true

  Object-with-nullable-false:
    type: object
    properties:
      Data:
        type: object
    x-nullable: false
```

## Steps to reproduce
`swagger generate model`

```go
// Case1FailOmitemptyFalseNotHoistedByRef case 1 fail omitempty false not hoisted by ref
// swagger:model Case-1--Fail--omitempty-false-not-hoisted-by-ref
type Case1FailOmitemptyFalseNotHoistedByRef struct {

        // body
        Body *ObjectWithOmitemptyFalse `json:"Body,omitempty"`
}

// Case2FailOmitemptyFalseNotOverriddenByRefSibling case 2 fail omitempty false not overridden by ref sibling
// swagger:model Case-2--Fail--omitempty-false-not-overridden-by-ref-sibling
type Case2FailOmitemptyFalseNotOverriddenByRefSibling struct {

        // body
        Body *ObjectWithOmitemptyTrue `json:"Body"`
}
```

Given that case 1 fails, it's actually rather convenient for our real use-case that case 2 "works": it allows us ultimately to get the `omitempty` behaviour we want.

## Environment
swagger version: master v0.21.0-13-g2600b738
go version: 1.13.4 
OS: linux/amd64
